original_body_lines: Pakistan declared their first innings on 576 for 5 in the second Test against Sri Lanka at the SSC, with a lead of 410.
While the expectation was for Pakistan to declare overnight, captain Babar Azam allowed Agha Salman and Mohammad Rizwan to bat two overs before calling his team back in.
Salman played out a maiden in the first over, before Rizwan scored three boundaries in the next, bowled by Prabath Jayasuriya, to bring up his 50.
Azam them promptly declared, sending the home team back out to bat with a huge deficit to wipe out.
